Welcome,

If you’ve landed here, you’re probably wondering who I am and the purpose of this site.

Purpose

This site is my playpen, a place for some self-promotion, and documentation center. My interests range from libraries, to historical research, to data visualization. As such, sharing my ideas normally involves some html, css, and a bit of javascript. If you’re interested in collaborating or like something you see, feel free to check me out on GitHub.

About me

THOMAS HOHENSTEIN

Worcester, MA • tomhohenstein.com

Experience

2013-Present

WORCESTER POLYTECHNIC INSTITUTE Worcester, MA

Research and Instruction Librarian

  • Coordinated and conducted outreach and instruction services to graduate students achieving a 300% increase in student contacts and a 200% increase in sessions
  • Served on the library’s Web Committee and currently responsible for transitioning research guides to LibGuides 2.0
  • Founding member and co-chair of the Blog Squad resulting in 85% of library staff authoring posts and doubling the number of posts published
  • Founding member of the Assessment Task Force charged to developing best practices, documenting current activities, and recommending future strategies
  • Provided both virtual and in-person research consultations to first-year students, undergraduate project teams, graduate students, and faculty members

2010-2013

UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS-AMHERST Amherst, MA

Teaching Assistant / Fellow

  • Collaborated with faculty to evaluate over 220 undergraduate students, manage course outcomes, establish learning objectives, and lead discussions
  • Awarded: Bauer-Gordon Fellowship, Potash Latin American Award, ETHIR Fellowship, and Teaching Assistant scholarships
  • Designed and developed an online exhibit and mobile walking tour web-application, to promote digital humanities initiatives

2006-2010

HARVARD LAW SCHOOL LIBRARY Cambridge, MA

Pound Project Librarian / Harvard Depository Coordinator / Serials Assistant

  • Promoted from entry-level non-exempt position to Librarian in 2 years
  • 5-time recipient of the Peer-to-Peer Reward and Recognition Award
  • Supervised the time-sensitive relocation of over 70,000 items published in 6 languages to the Harvard Depository from 3 different locations
  • Managed 2 FT, 3 casual employees, 4 interns, and 5 time-split employees from multiple departments to double the project’s productivity
  • Member of Harvard Library Innovation Lab, 4+ hiring committees, and the Communications team; founding member of the Macro Group

Education

2010-2012

UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS-AMHERST Amherst, MA

Master of Arts in Latin American History, G.P.A. 3.95

2006-2008

SIMMONS COLLEGE Boston, MA

Master of Library and Information Science, G.P.A. 3.94

2000-2004

GUSTAVUS ADOLPHUS COLLEGE St. Peter, MN

Bachelor of Arts in History with honors distinctions, magna cum laude

Additional

  • Memberships: NEASIST Board and Program Committee; Science Boot Camp Planning Committee; NELIG Annual Planning Committee; and DST4L
  • Reading proficiency in Spanish with basic conversational skills; studied in Guatemala, Costa Rica, Panama, Mexico, and Nicaragua
  • Proficient in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, PHP, XML, MARC, Dublin Core, and learning Python
